results.title: Eire
results.creator_credit: Arthur Guest and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Class-room film on the geography and economy of Eire. Scenes of the western coastal region of county Mayo and Galway; the River Shannon and the hydro-electric scheme; the machine-cut turf from the Bog of Allen and the turf-fired power station at Port Arlington; the making of cream and butter from the milk of the Golden Vale. Final sequences show great ports and centres of trade in Eire.

results.title: Einstein: the story of the man by his friends
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary dealing with the life and work of Albert Einstein using historical footage and interviews with friends and colleagues. The film explores Einstein’s childhood, education, work, migration and political beliefs. His theories are explained using simple, unscientific terms. Tragically, despite his pacifism, Einstein’s work was instrumental in the creation of the atomic bomb. Includes footage of Einstein with Charlie Chaplin, at a ceremony in his honour hosted by George Bernard Shaw, visiting California between the wars and receiving a Nobel prize. It also contains historical footage of the World Wars including the burning of books by the Nazi party and attacks on Jewish homes and businesses. Narrated by John Stockbridge. Photographed by Eugene Carr, Len Newson and Tony Leggo. Edited by Ted Walter.

results.title: Eikon
results.brief_description: An experimental film with triple image effects done in the camera using a matte-box. The central image was filmed after the two side sections - the side sections being shot in a random way and no record kept of the various shots. Colour filters were used with the camera and not in the laboratory. The subject reminded the filmmakers of faces and figures in old icons, the triptych structure of the images also echoes the icon. An interesting blend of stillness, movement, rocks, flesh, woman, girl, water, sky, colour, light, wind, sun and foliage.

results.title: Eighteenth century England: people and places
results.brief_description: Neoclassicism, romanticism, rebellion and adventure are some of the facets of the eighteenth century shown, by this film, through paintings by Hogarth and Gainsborough, the architecture of famous English house, sculpture, figurines, and scenes of navigation instruments and ships. These are used to illustrate the lives and ideas of both aristocrats and commoners in eighteenth-century England.

results.title: Eighteen Footers [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An exciting and visually beautiful study of yachting on Sydney Harbour, with special reference to the Australian designed eighteen footer, one of the speediest craft of its kind in the world. Describes the standard design, how it evolved and a number of variations. Portrays the exhilaration of racing the craft and demonstrates handling technique

results.title: Eighteen Footers [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film depicts sailing on Sydney Harbour in the locally designed eighteen foot open skiffs, fast four-man craft with unrestricted sail area. Describes the standard design and its evolution and shows the boats in action in a race illustrating handling technique

results.title: Eight out of ten
results.brief_description: In its appeals, the American Cancer Society has found that eight out of ten people will give money if properly approached. Here is shows how the successful first appeal of the Arizona section was run; from the recruiting of chairman and leaders, through publicity and education, to the vital face-to-face method of appeal.

results.title: Eight months to Mars
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: This film shows the problems encountered in sending Mariner IV 325 million miles through space to explore Mars. Designed to inform the layperson in terms which will be understood, the film also explains scientific readings and photographs from Mariner IV. Narrated by John Fitch.
